step1.title: Legal Considerations
step1.facilityLegalText1: As a facility representative, you are responsible for ensuring that all data provided is accurate and that you have the authority to act on behalf of the organization.
step1.facilityLegalText2: Swiss labor laws regarding maximum working hours (LTr) and rest periods must be strictly observed when scheduling shifts. Employers share liability for labor law violations if they are aware of a worker's secondary employment.
step1.facilityLegalText3: By proceeding, you agree to our Terms of Business and data processing agreements specifically tailored for healthcare facilities in Switzerland.
step1.professionalLegalText1: Swiss Labor Law sets a strict maximum of 50 hours per week. If you work 100% (42h), taking extra shifts may be illegal without prior authorization.
step1.professionalLegalText2: The Duty of Loyalty (Art. 321a CO) requires you to obtain written permission from your main employer to work for a competitor.
step1.professionalLegalText3: You must alternate rest periods: 11 consecutive hours of rest are required between shifts. Working during paid holidays (vacation) is legally restricted to recovery purposes.
step1.professionalLegalText4: By proceeding, you acknowledge that you are solely responsible for managing your working hours across different employers.
step1.termsAcceptanceDescription: Confirm you agree to these legal terms.
step1.note: Note: Your selection here determines the legal framework that will apply to your account and shift management.
